_A_PAGINATION_COMPONENT_DESCRIPTION_: The APagination component renders navigation for large data sets. It combines per-page controls, desktop and mobile layouts, and emits update:limit / update:offset events so the consuming view can stay in sync with the current page.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_COUNT_ALL_ROWS_DESCR: Total amount of rows that exist in the entire data set. This value drives the from-to counter and the number of available pages.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_DISABLED_DESCRIPTION: Disables all pagination controls. Useful while rows are being reloaded or when navigation must be blocked.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_LIMIT_DESCRIPTION_: Number of rows that should be returned per page. The component emits update:limit when the user selects a new value.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_LIMITS_PER_PAGE_DESC: List of options that appear in the per-page selector. Values can be strings or numbers and usually mirror the backend limits.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_MAX_PAGES_DESCRIPTIO: Maximum amount of numbered page buttons that may be shown at once before truncation with ellipsis.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_OFFSET_DESCRIPTION_: Index of the first row that belongs to the current page. The component emits update:offset every time the user navigates.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_ROWS_LENGTH_DESCRIPT: How many rows are actually rendered on the current page. Needed to correctly display the 'from-to' counter when the last page is incomplete.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_TOTAL_ROWS_COUNT_DES: Number that is announced together with the counter and per-page text. Usually the same as count-all-rows.
_A_PAGINATION_PROPS_MODES_DESCRIPTION_: Display configuration for desktop and mobile layouts. Each platform can define how per-page controls and the pager should behave (grouped buttons, select dropdown, short navigation, etc.).
